title: Query Optimization
description: Techniques to improve query performance and efficiency.
code:
-- EXPLAIN ANALYZE
EXPLAIN ANALYZE 
SELECT * FROM orders 
WHERE created_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days';

-- Avoid SELECT *
SELECT id, name, email FROM users; -- Better
SELECT * FROM users; -- Avoid

-- Use LIMIT
SELECT * FROM posts 
ORDER BY created_at DESC 
LIMIT 100;

-- Indexes for WHERE, JOIN, ORDER BY
CREATE INDEX idx_orders_created_at ON orders(created_at);
CREATE INDEX idx_order_items_order_id ON order_items(order_id);

-- Use EXISTS instead of COUNT
SELECT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM users WHERE email = 'test@example.com');
-- Instead of: SELECT COUNT(*) > 0 FROM users WHERE...
example:
-- Avoid OR, use UNION
SELECT * FROM products WHERE category = 'Electronics'
UNION
SELECT * FROM products WHERE category = 'Computers';

-- Use BETWEEN instead of >= AND <=
SELECT * FROM orders 
WHERE created_at BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-12-31';

-- Avoid functions on indexed columns
-- Bad: WHERE LOWER(email) = 'test@example.com'
-- Good: WHERE email = 'test@example.com'

-- Use prepared statements
PREPARE user_query AS 
SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1;
EXECUTE user_query(5);
useCase: Performance tuning, reducing query time, scalability, production optimization
